title: Study Away info session
description: Courtney will be holding a study away info session for the following programs: DIS, FSC, and ISS.

title: Cruise Automation Info Session
description: Cruise Automation will be bringing two speakers for this info session. Remember to bring your resumes, and RSVP to Suzanne so she can order the right number of pizzas for attendees.

title: Spring Gathering
description: See this airtable for activities to sign up for as we convene together for a break these semester.

title: The MIX open discussion on George Floyd
description: The MIX creates a safe space for all members of our Olin community to discuss their thoughts and feelings about George Floyd and racism in today's world.

title: SODIUM "Late Night Special"
description: Come take a study break with your favorite comedy group on campus.

title: PowerChords spring teaser
description: PowerChords has a surprise for you! Come join us in the O, we promise to not disappoint :)

title: Chips and guac with shop NINJAs
description: Come by to hang with the shop NINJAs while you work on your pieces!

title: Candidate's Weekend 1
description: Join us in welcoming prospective members of the Class of 2025! See emails from Alia about ways to help out with the weekend if you'd like to get involved.

title: NCHA Results Presentation for Students
description: Come join us in learning about NCHA results for Olin students versus the national average.

title: SLAC: Watch and Discuss a Documentary with the Eco-Reps :)
description: The Eco-Reps are bored (and so are you!), so come watch a documentary with us. There will a discussion on Zoom afterwards! BYOP (bring your own popcorn)]

title: COVID-19 update

I‚Äôve been asked to give an update to my earlier webinars about COVID-19, which I am happy to do on Tuesday, April 14 at 12:30 pm EDT.

title: OPEN "Brunch"
description: OPEN leadership is going to host zoom call brunches for the rest of the semester at 3pm eastern on Sundays. Here's the zoom link: https://olin.zoom.us/j/352828949

title: SLAC: üåé Geoguessr World Adventure ‚úàÔ∏è ‚Äì Sam Daitzman and Becca
description: Do you miss the experience of traveling new roads? Do you wish you could see a new and unfamiliar place? Do you want to be dropped in a village in Europe, then spend several minutes desperately hunting for a street sign? Join us and play Geoguessr, the game where you're dropped in an unknown place on Google Street View and guess your current location based on what you see.

title: Research talk from alum Yiyang Li '11: Accelerating machine learning using analogue materials & Data feminism
description:
Accelerating machine learning using analogue materials, memory devices, and circuits 

Machine learning and artificial neural networks are powerful and ubiquitous systems, but consume significant quantities of energy. The high energy consumption arises from the inefficiencies of using digital processors for data processing. Inspired by the energy-efficient human brain, we use analogue approaches which are 100-1000 times more energy efficient than optimized digital processors. Here, we compute directly using materials with a known resistance combining Ohm‚Äôs Law and Kirchoff‚Äôs Law. We design devices whose resistances can be switched from a large number of analogue resistance states based on the principles of electrochemical ion insertion and extraction.

Yiyang Li completed his BS at Olin College (2011), his PhD at Stanford University (2016), and is currently a postdoc at Sandia National Labs. He will start as an assistant professor at the University of Michigan in Fall 2020.
